abstract.text: A polygon-shaped impassable area in a 2D game world.

inlineContent.text: Polygon obstacles serve two purposes in GameplayKit: You can use polygon obstacles to construct a navigability graph of your game world (a
object) for use in pathfinding. You can also use polygon obstacles to define regions for agents (

To easily create obstacles for use with a SpriteKit game, create and arrange a set of nodes that define the non-navigable regions of your game world. You can create such nodes programmatically, or use the SpriteKit Scene Editor in Xcode. If you’re already using nodes with physics bodies to keep sprites from entering those regions, you can reuse those nodes. Then, use the
method to generate a set of
To learn more about both ways of using polygon obstacles, see

abstract.text: Converts each node into an obstacle by transforming its bounds into the scene’s coordinate system.
Converts each node into an obstacle by transforming the node’s physics body shape into the scene’s coordinate system.
Turns each node into an obstacle by changing the node’s texture into a physics shape and converting it into the scene’s coordinate system.
Architect and organize your game logic. Incorporate common gameplay behaviors such as random number generation, artificial intelligence, pathfinding, and agent behavior.
A component that moves a game entity according to a set of goals and realistic constraints.
A circular impassable area to be avoided by agents.
An influence that motivates the movement of one or more agents.
Creates a goal whose effect is to make an agent avoid colliding with the specified static obstacles.
The abstract base class for objects representing impassable areas in a game world.
A navigation graph for 2D game worlds that creates a minimal network for precise pathfinding around obstacles.
A polygon-shaped impassable area in a 2D game world.
Initializes a polygon obstacle with the specified list of vertices.
Creates a polygon obstacle with the specified list of vertices.
Returns the point coordinates of the specified vertex.
The number of vertices that define the polygon-shaped area of the obstacle.
A spherical impassable volume to be avoided by agents.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
